column4: I'm thinking jack shouldn't be that complicated to use. Am I wrong?
any way to test if I've correctly installed my tascam us-122
don't take my word for it, I don't have it working yet.
- Well, wouldn't mind hearing if you end up sorting it out. ;]
this is the link to directions on how to install it: http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-30891.html The link to the RPM is broken, but someone here helped me find one.
- To start, alsa doesn't have a 'firmware' version ... just a version. :]
- And the other thing is that the package version, that you see with dpkg/synaptic, isn't necessarily the same as the kernel drivers version, that you see in /proc/asound/version.
all I know is that's included in the name of somethign I have to have.
- I've got the same setup you describe, 1.0.6 in /proc/asound/version, and 1.0.8-4ubuntu4 for the package version.
on the ardour channel someone came to the conclusion that my package of alsa-firmware didn't support the us-122.
- Sorry, I'm not sure how to update/change the alsa firmware package, I don't see it listed in ubuntu. Maybe it's a part of another package?
I'm fast finding out that I really need a release more geared to multi-media, audio specifically.
- If you're running Linux to do audio stuff, I'd agree.
I'm getting recommended to use FC CCRMA
